thread.title: Lauren Goodger planning to have sex with criminal boyfriend Joey in PRISON
thread.title_full: Lauren Goodger planning to have sex with criminal boyfriend Joey in PRISON

author: Emmeline Saunders
title: Lauren Goodger planning to have sex with criminal boyfriend Joey in PRISON
text:
Showbiz Lauren Goodger planning to have sex with criminal boyfriend Joey in PRISON The former TOWIE star has revealed she's been celibate for a year and can't wait to get her boyfriend alone Share British TV Personality Lauren Goodger pictured with her new boyfriend Joey Morrison (Photo: FameFlynet) Share   
Lauren Goodger has revealed that she and convict boyfriend Joey Morrison have yet to have sex – because he's lost his day release privileges while banged up in prison. 
That's not stopping the ex-TOWIE star though, as she's claimed she's putting an end to her year-long spell of celibacy the next time she gets Joey alone – which could well be inside the prison grounds, if he's allowed out of his cell without supervision. 
"Joey's going to be knackered when we're finally alone because we'll be very busy," she told Closer magazine. 
"I've been properly celibate for a year, but he's worth the wait." Lauren has been working out under instruction from Joey (Photo: laurenrosegoodger/Instagram) She claims to have been celibate for a year (Photo: Instagram/laurenrosegoodger) 
Admitting that she is nervous that she's forgotten what to do in the bedroom, Lauren said she feels like a teenager again. 
"But one thing's for sure: my underwear is going to be unreal. There's been so much chemistry and build-up – it's going to be amazing," she added. 
But her plans may fall short when she learns inmates are not permitted to have sex in prison grounds under the Incentives and Earned Privileges scheme. 
Joey – short for Joseph – has been in jail since 2010 after being convicted of aggravated burglary, kidnap, ABH and possession of a firearm. Joey was jailed for a string of crimes, including possession of a firearm and aggravated burglary (Photo: Internet Unknown) But the reality star claims everyone needs to give him another chance (Photo: Instagram) 
He and an accomplice were sentenced to 16 years in jail, but it's thought Joey will be released before March 2018 after serving half his term. 
At the time of his arrest, he was caught with £60,000 worth of cocaine and £10,000 in cash – but Lauren has previously said that she's not bothered by his criminal past. 
On Channel 5's In Therapy this January, she admitted that her friends have warned her to steer clear of her "controlling" boyfriend. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
